title: How to Hide Video Player Controls on YouTube on Android

steps.title: Launch the YouTube app on your Android device.
steps.content: Launch the YouTube app on your Android device. You can find the app icon on your app drawer.

steps.title: Tap on your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap on your profile icon. You can see this icon at the top-right corner of the app. The menu panel will show up.

steps.title: Tap on Settings.
steps.content: Tap on Settings . This will be the second last option in the menu panel.

steps.title: Select the Accessibility setting from there.
steps.content: Select the Accessibility setting from there. Scroll down to the bottom and tap on the “Accessibility” option.

steps.title: Turn off the “Accessibility player”.
steps.content: Turn off the “Accessibility player”. Tap on the slider next to the “Accessibility player” to disable the extra video player controls in the player. The slider will turn grey. That's it! You can also set a timer to automatically hide the video player controls after specific seconds. Navigate to the “Hide player controls” option to do it.
